de.weltraumschaf.commons.characters

Class CharacterStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.weltraumschaf.commons.characters.CharacterStream

  • public class CharacterStream
extends Object
    Access a string as stream of characters.

    Example: 

     final CharacterStream characterStream = new CharacterStream("...");

 while (characterStream.hasNext()) {
     final char currentChar = characterStream.next();
     // Do something with the current char.
 }

    TODO: Implement line and column.
    Author:
    Sven Strittmatter

      • next

        public char next()
        Returns next character.
        Returns:
        next character // CHECKSTYLE:OFF
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if, there are no more characters. // CHECKSTYLE:ON

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        True if there are more characters.
        Returns:
        True if there are no more characters.

      • current

        public char current()
        Returns the current character. If next() not yet called, it is called implicitly.
        Returns:
        The current character.

      • peek

        public char peek()
        Look ahead one character w/o advancing the internal pointer for the current character.
        Returns:
        the peeked character. // CHECKSTYLE:OFF
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are no more character to peek // CHECKSTYLE:ON

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Get the current index position.
        Returns:
        initial value is -1, after first call of next 0 up to input length - 1
